explainability.path_to_improvement: Document how explanations are provided to users affected by AI decisions.

external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Obtain external validation of AI practices or require vendor certifications.

fairness.path_to_improvement: Document bias testing procedures or vendor AI fairness requirements.

governance.findings: A technical paper references the implied need for established governance structures. These structures are referenced in the context of overseeing the implementation and impact of an AI tool developed for accident investigation and analysis.
governance.path_to_improvement: Name an AI governance body with defined mandate covering all AI use.

relevant_sources.summary: This technical paper, "AI-Assisted Accident Investigation Project," provides evidence for the **governance** pillar. The project's development of an AI tool for accident investigation and analysis, which aims to improve safety processes, implies the need for established governance structures to oversee its implementation and impact.
relevant_sources.title: AI-Assisted Accident Investigation Project

oversight.path_to_improvement: Document human review processes for AI-assisted decisions (built or vendor AI).

privacy.path_to_improvement: Document data protection practices for AI systems, including vendor AI data handling.

transparency.path_to_improvement: Document AI systems in use, including vendor/third-party AI tools.

summary.overall_findings: Cleveland-Cliffs' published materials reference the implied need for established governance structures to oversee the implementation and impact of an AI tool developed for accident investigation and analysis. This documentation addresses governance as the sole pillar among 7 evaluated responsible AI areas. No qualifying public evidence was found for the majority of the 7 evaluated pillars, based on a review of 2 publicly available sources.
